msContents.summary: The Wisconsin part of this papyrus (lines 33-40; 74-79; 108-113; 172-180) was originally published by G. Malz, Another Zenon Papyrus at the University of Wisconsin, AJA 39 (1935), pp. 373-376 (= SB V 7686).;At least one line has been lost between lines 32 and 33 (there may have also been a blank space of one line preceding the account for Tybi). More than one line may have been lost between lines 72 and 74 (the upper edge of column II of P.Wisc. inv. 2 is blank). One or two lines and a blank space must have been lost between lines 107 and 108, while between lines 171 and 172 again a few lines seem to be missing. ;Lines 112 and 113 seem to be written by a different hand. For the hands on the verso cf. PCZ III 59328, 116-160 note and G. Malz, loc. cit.

msItemStruct.note: Location: Department of Special Collections; Memorial Library; Madison; Wisconsin
Pub. status: recto; the verso is blank

condition.ab: A light-brown papyrus with dark stains, regularly brokenoff at the bottom and at the left and right-hand sides. With the big fragment of the Wisconsin papyrus goes a small one (1.2 x 2 cm) with traces of 1 line.

layout.ab: P.Wisc. inv. 2 + PCZ III 59328:;recto: col. I: 40 lines; col. II 39 lines; col. III: 34 lines; col. IV: 23 lines; verso: col. I 44 lines; col. II 16 lines

handDesc.p: P.Wisc. inv. 2: There is a margin of approximately 9 cm at the right. At the bottom the margin is 4 cm and at the left-hand side 1 cm. Three columns written along the fibers. At 14 cm from the left hand side there is a kollema.One column is written across the fibers. Before this column 2.5 cm and behind it 20.5 cm have been left free.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: P.Wisc. inv. 2:;On the 1st of Tybi 1 for Athenagoras 1 (kid), 4 cheeses; on the 2nd for Athenagoras 1, 4 cheeses; on the 3rd for Athenagoras 1, 4 cheeses; on the 4th for Athenagoras 1, 4 cheeses; on the 5th for Athenagoras 1, 4 cheeses; These have been given through Limnaios;;For Kallippos, on receipt of a letter, a kid which the brother Limnaios received; on the 15th for Kritolaos through Antipatros 1 kid;;of which was spent for wages (for the care) of the offspring of the 140 (goats) for Epeiph and Mesore of the 36th year, each month, 3 drachmae, 3 obols, total 7 drachmae.;162;30;;verso:;of these for Sostratos 2kids, Nikandros has the remainder 212, of these 15 for Asklepiades, 5 for Philinos 5 He has 1, for sale 192 and what he has deducted on this he gave to Philinos 4;Total 196;

listBibl.bibl: Malz G, AJA 39 , 373-376, 1935 -- V 7686 Sijpesteijn PJ , P.Wisc. II, 78, 1977, Plate XXXIII -- For both PCZ III 59328 + P.Wisc. inv. 2: BL Corcondance, 269 (lines 108-123, 116, 117, 129, 143, 148); BL VIII, 512 (line 159; menaing of "teleiai")
